Package index

About OpenTelemetry in R

The otel package is an implementation of the OpenTelemetry API. Use the otel package to instrument your R package or project for OpenTelemetry data collection. See the otelsdk package for collecting OpenTelemetry data for an instrumented package or project.

Configuration

The otel package is in charge for selecting the exporters for OpenTelemetry data (traces, metrics, logs), and it can be configured with environment variables.

If you want to produce telemetry data from an instrumented R package or project, read Environment variables.

If you are a package author and want to use otel to instrument your package, then read about default_tracer_name().

Environment variables
Environment variables to configure otel
default_tracer_name()
Default tracer name (and meter and logger name) for an R package

Traces

A trace is a path of a request through your application. For R package or project a trace can be a script run or a top-level function call from a script or from the R console. A trace is a hierarchy of spans, a span is the unit of work or operation.

Instrumentation

The simplest way to instrument your R package is to add start_span() calls at the beginning of the functions that you want telemetry data for. Use is_tracing() to avoid unnecessary computation when tracing is off. You occasionally need get_tracer() to handle advanced use cases.

get_tracer()
Get a tracer from the default tracer provider
is_tracing()
Check whether OpenTelemetry tracing is active
otel_span
TODO
start_span()
Start a new OpenTelemetry span, using the default tracer

Concurrency

To support concurrency on a single thread, e.g. a Shiny app serving multiple requests at the same time, you can manage the lifetime and activation of the OpenTelemetry spans manually.

local_active_span()
Activate an OpenTelemetry span for an R scope
with_active_span()
Evaluate R code with an active OpenTelemetry span
